body:
I don't think we want large base64 blobs in markdown cells. But supporting
image uploading is something we should support, both in the dashboard and
in the notebook area.

On Sun, Feb 9, 2014 at 11:57 AM, Juergen Hasch notifications@github.comwrote:

> I have been playing with putting static graphics as base64 encoded data in
> markdown cells. The idea was to add (small) illustrations to a notebook
> without the need for external references.
> 
> Technically, I use the <embed src="..." /> tag for this and make the
> cells read-only.
> This prevents edit mode and codemirror having to swallow the large chunk
> of data, possibly crashing the browser.
> 
> Over the weekend I came across the Drag&Drop interface of Firefox and
> Chrome, which makes it extremely easy to add graphics just by dragging them
> into the notebook. This way one can easily put megabytes of image data into
> the notebook.
> 
> I would like to get some feedback on how the IPython developers see this
> "feature".
> Should it be possible to add large images to a notebook this way ?
> 
> ## 
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/5082
> .

## 

Brian E. Granger
Cal Poly State University, San Luis Obispo
bgranger@calpoly.edu and ellisonbg@gmail.com
Thanks for the feedback. I think I will add a warning box for large images (> 100k or so).
